body_html:
@yaroslavvb wrote:

Since only workers construct the graph, "/gpu:0" should resolve to worker's /gpu:0

That's not how the placement algorithm works. You must include "/job:worker" in the device spec to guarantee that the op will be placed on a task in the worker job.

If you override the default worker_device argument (which is "/job:worker") with "/gpu:0", there's no guarantee that the task will be placed in any particular task.

body:
@yaroslavvb wrote:
> Since only workers construct the graph, "/gpu:0" should resolve to worker's /gpu:0

That's not how the placement algorithm works. You must include `"/job:worker"` in the device spec to guarantee that the op will be placed on a task in the `worker` job.

If you override the default `worker_device` argument (which is `"/job:worker"`) with `"/gpu:0"`, there's no guarantee that the task will be placed in any particular task.
